comment.author: 39397903@N00
comment._content: Most likely these aircraft workers were over the age of 18 when the photos were taken.  That being the case, it would be more accurate to refer to each of them as a woman rather than as a girl.

comment.author: 36421367@N00
comment._content:
I'd bet a latte that the titles are taken word-for-word from the captions each photo was assigned at the time it was taken (or at the very least, when they were processed into the collection at the LoC). 

I doubt it'll come as a newsflash to anyone that things were a bit different in 1942 than they are in 2008...

comment.author: 23375095@N00
comment._content: A real life Rosie the Riveter.

comment.author: 11165679@N03
comment._content:
The photographer is amazing... each shot is composed like a Vermeer

There is that same sense of concentrated purpose, although its clearly very posed.

Just lovely.

comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: Where in the world was OSHA?  LOL  My things have changed.

comment.author: 23173002@N03
comment._content: The seeming carryover of 'sewing machine' is rather... riveting. The first thing that occurred to me looking at this was, "Could they possibly have managed to better imply a woman at her sewing machine?" The implication of woman's work being set in this manner as a demonstration of service to country and men overall is rather poignant and, to me, beautiful.

comment.author: 24829762@N00
comment._content:
Living during those times (I in the Pacific Theatre and my sister in a "War Plant" (as we called them - not factories - don`t know why) we didn`t get all bent out of shape about women`s rights, etc - just did the job.

Bear in mind we just started to come out of the Depression (this one in 2008 is a walk in the park so far) and besides patriotism (which was expected not an exception) many were elated merely to have a job and food on the table with decent clothing.

comment.author: 9643110@N08
comment._content: Nice. Hi, I'm an admin for a group called People love their Work, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 9135061@N07
comment._content: ..splendid stream with a lot of concentration..

comment.author: 77975599@N03
comment._content: Your looking at the quintessential “Rosie The Riveter”. God bless the American female, they put them in the air during the war.
